test
Class Crossflip

java.lang.Object
  test.Crossflip

public class Crossflip
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used to solve the levels of a game called Crossflip, found at hacker.org/crossflip. It is a sigma+-game where with a move on one node the node itself and the nodes in the same row or column change their color. It is also possible to have some free fields in the field, which are not part of the game.

Author:
Irene Thesing

Method Detail

makeGame

public static Game makeGame(java.lang.String input)
Creates a sigma-game and the corresponding GameGraph from a String which encodes the Crossflip-game. The aim is to turn all lights on.

Parameters:
input - the string where the game is coded. It has a form like "1110,2221", where a "," marks the beginning of a new row, a 2 marks that the field is not part of the game, a 1 marks an off-tourned light and a zero an on-turned light.
Returns:
the game which simulates the Crossflip-game.

solveCrossflipp

public static java.lang.String solveCrossflipp(java.lang.String input)
This method solves the Crossflip game created by the given String by translating it into a #Game and solvint this game.

Parameters:
input - the coded Crossflip game.
Returns:
the solution of the game, encoded by values 0 and 1 for all the nodes, 1 if it must be chosen, 0 if it must not be chosen and also 0 if the node is not part of the game so in the input coded with 2.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Solves the Crossflip game, which is given coded as String in the second parameter of args and writes the coded solution in System.out.

Parameters:
args - The arguments must be of the form --board --level .
